intro: Japanobotrychum lanuginosum var. nepalense, commonly known as the Nepalese flax plant, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of Nepal and northern India. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. This variant is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its unique foliage.
